summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons memorandum from a Captain at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 10, 2019. It details informal training sessions conducted with staff in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) following management concerns about inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The memo references a prior incident on July 23, 2019, where Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell after an apparent suicide attempt, and emphasizes security expectations, including that Epstein was to be housed with a cellmate.

keyFacts: The document is a BOP memorandum created on August 10, 2019, following an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein.
It confirms that on July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC after an 'apparent suicide attempt'.
The memo states a specific security expectation: 'inmate Epstein was to housed with a cell mate'.
It details apparent security concerns in the SHU, including blocked observation windows, torn bed sheets, and accumulation of food trays.
The training was prompted to prevent 'another occurrence' of the July 23 incident.
